name: Sylla-Sling
description:
Sylla-Sling is a simple 2D puzzle game designed for students from grades 1-3rd grades. The game is meant to help students broadly learn what it is like to read with Dyslexia.  The player helps the game's main character read his book by decoding and breaking down difficult words into syllables and then arranging them so they can be read more easily. The project intended to make an educational experience for the player while not only demonstrating what difficulties a student with dyslexia may face but also how they have tools they can use to work through their struggles, demonstrating the strategies that aid in decoding

This project was made in four weeks
